messages: 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:30): crap, misentered the url in the recent twitter

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:33): so no need

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:35): and i follow them both
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (12:35): the way WP has been set up is to treat blog.whatwg.org/(.*) as the title, and then it just searches the db for the closest match
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:35): so you'd think i'd be able to work it out
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (12:36): I generally don't follow twitter conversations much
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (12:36): I would follow more if I could get tircd working, but I can't get my IRC client to connect to it properly
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:37): what does it do?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:37): i don't see why x-chat would fail
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:37): you're joining the #twitter channel?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:37): and sending it the password?
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (12:38): yes. X-Chat just says "Connected. Now logging in...", but never proceeds any further.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:38): what does tircd's console say?
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (12:39): it gives an error.  I will try now and see
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (12:40): $ ./tircd.pl tircd.cfg
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (12:40): [Sun Apr  5 11:36:23 2009] tircd 0.7 started, using config from: tircd.cfg.
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (12:40): [Sun Apr  5 11:36:51 2009]  f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220] storage_path is not set or is not writable, not saving configuration.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:40): i wonder why xchat is disconnecting
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:41): you sure you got the right password?
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (12:41): I disconnected it myself, cause otherwise it just sits there doing nothing forever
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:41): oh
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (12:41): I've left if go for several minutes on previous attempts with no luck

a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (12:42): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: fail.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:42): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: ?

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:42): i figured that out, but couldn't work out what karl had said
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (12:44): [11:39]  * - tircd Message of the Day -
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (12:44): [11:39]  * - This code is uber alpha, if you got this far, consider yourself lucky
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (12:44): [11:39]  * - /join #twitter to get started!
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (12:44): [11:39]  * - /stats to set configurable options.
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (12:44): [11:39]  * - Please submit bug reports here: http://code.google.com/p/tircd/issues/list
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (12:44): [11:39]  * - Thanks for using tircd,
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (12:44): [11:39]  * - @tircd on twitter. <<email/>>
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:44): and did you try /join #twitter?
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (12:44): [11:39]  * NICKSERV :Unable to send direct message.  Perhaps NICKSERV isn't following you?
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (12:44): [11:39]  * Disconnected (Remote host closed socket).
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:44): why are you sending a msg to NICKSERV?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:45): if you get the motd, as you do, that means you are connecting properly
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (12:45): Can't call method "http_code" on an undefined value at ./tircd.pl line 910.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:45): interesting
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:45): looks at tircd.pl line 910
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (12:46): I have x-chat setup to automatically send the password, and it must be trying /msg nickserv with it by default
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:46): that's not the kind of password you should be sending
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (12:46): that's how it works with freednode at least
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:46): you should be sending an IRC password, not a nick services password
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (12:47): now it works
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (12:48): is thoroughly confused about InCoreignContent and isn't sure if he is silly or if the spec is broken
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (12:48): *InForeignContent
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:48): spec could definitely be broken
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (12:48): it still complains about storage_path not being writable. Maybe I need to set that to something different in the cfg file
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (12:48): I think waht hsivonen says about making foreigness a flag makes sense
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:48): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: i just ignored that message
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:49): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: it would be helpful to see an example showing that the two ways of speccing it aren't black-box identical
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (12:49): The case that html5lib chokes on at the mometn is like <svg><foreignContent><table></table></foreignContent><g></g>
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:50): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: send me a mail, i'll have a look at some point
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (12:50): Because the <table> changes the insertion mode to InTable so the <g> is processed InBody, notInForeignContent
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (12:50): now I just need to figure out how to make tircd.pl run automatically on startup, instead of requiring me to start it manually in terminal
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:51): use a launchd script
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (12:51): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: You a mail or WHATWG or public-html or‚Ä¶
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (12:51): Maybe I should start twittering bugs. It seems to be what all the cool kids are doing
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:52): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: whichever (direct mail if you want me to just look at it and say if it's a spec bug or not)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:53): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: put a file in ~/Library/LaunchAgents
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:53): google for the syntax
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:53): i don't seem to have ever done an on-boot one
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:54): only cronjob-like things
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (12:54): ok. I'll look into that later
